result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald F. Klaar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to follow through with any counseling recommendations per probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald F. Klaar

defendant.name: Klaar, Donald F.
defendant.address: W6643 Pine Grove Ln, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM Court calls case. DA Kelz states appearances. Defendant Donald F. Klaar in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. DA Kelz states Victim Right's Legislations have been complied with. Court questions DA Kelz on a "no contact" provision. DA Kelz gives responses. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 1 the State will move to Dismiss and Read in Ct's 2 and 3. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an Attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 therefore Ct's 2 and 3 are DISMISSED and READ IN. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. 

Ct. 1- Withheld Sentence- 1 Year Probation 
Conditions of Probation: 
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 
$100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Defendant is not allowed to engage in any future Criminal Domestic Abuse situations with the Victim 
Follow through with any and all recommendations for counseling per probation

Ct's 2 and 3- Dismissed and Read it


Appeal Rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:29 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Donald F. Klaar in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history of the case and states there was a bench warrant issued for the last non-appearance. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant. So Ordered.  Court questions defendant on non-appearance. Defendant gives responses. DA Kelz motions to have the previous bond re-instated along with any and all conditions. So Ordered. Court questions defendant on counsel. Defendant states he does not have an Attorney and does not anticipate obtaining one. Court explains the right to an Attorney and the waiver. DA Kelz questions the defendant in regards to the offer made by the District Attorney's Office back in March. Court orders defendant to make contact with the District Attorney's Office after this hearing. Defendant gives responses. Court adjourned.
Status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Paid in person cash bond set and signed. 2 certified copies returned from PRSO

11:0 AM DA Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Donald F. Klaar not in court.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history of notices sent and nothing has been returned undeliverable. DA Kelz motions for a bench warrant in the amount of $750. So ordered plus warrant fee.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:16 AM Defendant Donald F. Klaar appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court orders booking. Bond already set to continue.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): G.R.K unless a written consent to contact form is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office during business hours OR with the Price County Sheriff's Department outside of normal business hours
 * No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.
Defendant may not possess firearms

DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant Donald F. Klaar appeared via video from Price County Jail. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for The State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 02/15/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Defendant states he does not know the nature of the alleged charges filed against him. Court gives a summary of the charges and the incident. Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.
